resources.string:
CEEE++ stands for Cybele , Elie , Elie and Elias , 4 Electrical Engineering students whose aim is to help people overcome the situation due to the COVID-19 pandemic. 
Countries around the globe are facing challenges in assuring that people on mandatory confinement do not break the rules of security given by the governments. Therefore, in order to maintain general safety, we, CEEE++ team, put all our focus on creating a device that can help make sure the imposed rules are followed. 
People in confinement can wear our wearable bracelets and use this app to keep track of their location and health to ensure their safety. We are aiming to give you a great experience, that will help you overcome the situation as well as stay informed on how to stay safe. 

Stay at home. 
Stay Safe. 
Use QuarANTI-Virus.
You are in a seriously bad condition!
\nDon\'t freak out just yet maybe the reading are subject to external factors and malfunctions you should always check again with usual procedures.

string-array.name: tips
string-array.item: Stay Hydrated: Drink a lot of fluids.
Avoid any contact with your family. Wear a cloth face cover when they are around. .
Do not share household items with others. (dishes, cups…).
Sleep in a separate bedroom and use a private bathroom (if possible) .
Wash your hands with soap frequently and avoid touching your face.
Seek medical attention if symptoms appear/worsen.
Cover your nose with your elbow when sneezing.
Maintain a sense of hope and positive thinking.
Stay connected with your closed ones via “Video Calls” .
Make full use of your day by doing everything you couldn’t normally do.
Try to maintain a healthy diet.
Clear all high-touch surfaces every day.
Practice mindfulness and calming breathing techniques.
Stop smoking and drinking alcohol, these can affect your immunity.
Think of the love ones you’re protecting by staying at home.
Limit your “Covid 19” news intake.
Start reading the books on your shelf.
Stream a concert, opera or TV show.
Take a digital museum tour .
Host a Netflix viewing party with your friends.
Try doing some sports: it’s good for the heart.
Create art.
Learn a new language on Duolingo.
You can try your hand at writing to De-Stress.
Clean up your embarrassing pictures from Facebook.
Work on your dancing skills : it releases stress hormones.
Try out some new virtual glasses frames online on glassesusa.com.
Get out of your bubble by starting your own blog.
Don’t worry about your neighbors, dust off that old instrument and practice. .
Reconnect with old friends.
Watch all the really long movies you’ve avoided until now. .
Treat yourself to a skin care routine, from long baths to face masks .
Clean up your closet, you could use the free space.
Take time to reflect about your goals for the upcoming year.
Make a list of things for which you are grateful .
How many words per minute can you type? It’s time to find out.
Sleep. Get lots of it .
Take a (virtual) world tour.
Let it all out: talk to a therapist. You can arrange sessions online.
Challenge your brain in some brain games .
